page.title: 01Introduction, Murroes area
page.content: THE AREA DESCRIBED CONTAINS MUCH OF THE ECCLESIASTICAL PARISH OF MURROES. APART FROM{WELLBANK}VILLAGE AND {WESTHALL TERRACE,}IT IS ALMOST ENTIRELY INTENSIVELY FARMED LAND, RISING GENTLY FROM THE FORMER DUNDEE BOUNDARY TOWARDS THE FOOTHILLS OF THE SIDLAWS. IN 1976 WHEN TAYSIDE REGION WAS CREATED, THE CITY OF DUNDEE DISTRICT WAS EXTENDED TO INCLUDE MOST OF {MURROES PARISH.} A SMALL NUMBER OF THE RESIDENTS FIND WORK IN THE AREA, OFTEN IN AGRICULTURE OR RELATED INDUSTRIES, BUT THE MAJORITY COMMUTE THE SHORT DISTANCE TO WORK IN DUNDEE. ALTHOUGH SO CLOSE TO THE CITY, THE AREA IS SURPRISINGLY RURAL, WITH MANY FINDING AFTER-WORK INTERESTS IN THE NEIGHBOURHOOD.
